website_summaries.verdict: Similar to the original, the Momentus XT (second generation) makes an excellent host drive for any computer, both laptops and desktops. It offers great value in terms of performance and cost, especially when compared to SDDs.
pros: The Seagate Momentus XT (second generation) offers performance similar to solid-state drives (SSDs) while being much more affordable
The new drive now supports SATA 3 (6Gbps) and provides 750GB of storage space
cons: The new Seagate Momentus XT is noticeably more expensive than regular hard drives of the same storage space
Its data copy speed is comparatively slower than that of high-end hard drives

customer_reviews.title: Used in PS3 one year prior to release to now
customer_reviews.text: Initaially bought to use in a PS3, worked great, it increased speeds in some games. The 7200rpm never caused my ps3 to overheat. I was so happy with it, I wiped it clean and put it into an original ps4 on day 1 and its still there with everyday use. My only issue is games that save too much, it can cause data to corrupt. Only happened to a handful of games such as Skyrim, Dragon's Dogma, and once in a blue moon to Final Fantasy XIV. Always back up your files, it can happen with any drive though. Always was tempted to get a second for laptop if SSD prices were too high.
customer_reviews.author: Loswa

customer_reviews.title: HDD has been great, but eventually it seems slow once you get used to SSD's on other computers.
customer_reviews.text: Of course, SSD's weren't around when I bought this thing. I've had this about 8 years and it's still running strong. Solid performance and reliability in a 2008 Dell Studio 35 17" laptop. Maybe I'll take a bunch of old drives like this and make a RAID array someday . . .
customer_reviews.author: E. Friend

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my Macbook Aluminum (2008) hard drive with this!
customer_reviews.text: Night-and-day difference in the performance of my computer, 5X the storage capacity, 2X the speed of my old drive, 6GB flash storage, and nearly plug-and-play, made this an easy 5-star review. However, when I say plug-and-play, what I mean is that there wasn't too much to figure out. With some micro tools and google search, I did it in 10 minutes (minus the waiting period for the hard drive cloning part): after cloning the new hard drive, remove battery cover, remove screw securing hard drive, unplug hard drive, plug in new hard drive, secure it, and you're done. I think I have extended the life of my computer by another 3-4 years before I'll need a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Tabasco24

customer_reviews.title: Wish the cache size were bigger
customer_reviews.text: Its way faster than the 5900 rpm drive my laptop came with, boot times are most noticeably improved. I honestly don't think the SSD I eventually replaced this with boots any faster. Day to day use you can feel the small size of the cache, sometimes it takes forever to open a program, and you just know that one isn't in there. Also takes a really long time to come out of hibernation, maybe even longer than the 5900 rpm it replaced. Also you can really notice the increased power draw in reduced battery life. Overall not at all a bad drive but nowadays its not that much more to just get an SSD.
customer_reviews.author: thetacowarrior

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 6 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first one in 2012 and another for another laptop in 2014. Both are still going strong going into 2018. The good: Fast boot times, decent capacity. The Bad: Don't think for one second that this can be a substitute for an SSD. There is no comparison. This drive makes sense only for the price. I've read a number of reviews here regarding a high failure rate. Perhaps I've been lucky.
customer_reviews.author: Therwol

customer_reviews.title: Fast - Quiet - Cool and contains a lot of data at this price.
customer_reviews.text: Noticeably faster than the 500GB 5400RPM SATA I replaced. This is a silent and cooler running HDD than the smaller slower one I replaced. I have never been disappointed by Seagate disks. They are tough-built devices. I have yet to have one fail. I used this one to expand the HDD size of my 15" MacBook Pro (MBP) (late 2011) unibody laptop. I am delighted I chose this Seagate. My MBP is now silent when I used to roar when ramped up moving data. This device runs cooler than the Toshiba 500GB SATA it replaced. Both are good drives, this one is just ... better.
customer_reviews.author: Cazador

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Furious
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure there will be better drives with a bit more storage in 2014, but this is one of the few 6GBps/7200rpm 2.5 inch hybrids made in 2013. I put it in a 2011 Mac Book Pro and it now boots up ridiculously fast. Speeds are so much better than a standard HDD I am really quite amazed. It was important to me to not get a mere 3gbps version... and all the 1TB drives at this time are/were 5400RPM drives... For this moment, this was the drive to get if you were shopping for a hybrid. Great drive, so far so good, not an ounce of regret. It exceeds all expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Ardra

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding performance, plug and play!
customer_reviews.text: I own twoand loved the dramatic performance increase they had in my laptops. I bought this as a datastore drive for my home server. The drive works exceptionally fast, not as fast as a Solid State Drive but much faster that the other two 6GB/s drives I have installed as datastores. The price point for this is significantly cheaper than an SSD and, for daily use, you would be hard pressed to justify the increased expense and hassle of an SSD. (Note: hassle is only from smaller capacity, not from anything inherently more difficult in installation or operation of an SSD)
customer_reviews.author: James Wright

customer_reviews.title: Seagate Hybrid
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I've had this HDD for about 7 months and it is fast. It completes (in short bursts) with my desktop's Seagate Barracuda (2TB 7200 rpm 6Gb/s 64MB cache), so I think you'll be surprised. The fact it's half as good as my other HDD just shows that hybrid tech is worth the experimentation. I bet hybrid HDD's are gonna change HDD's forever. It's about time HDD's were improved!!!!!! I was extremely surprised this thing worked at all. I gave it 4 stars because it's noticably loud and I can feel the HDD moving inside the laptop. It's not noticable unless you're trying to notice it, if that makes any sense, but it can always be felt spinning away.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Kyle Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Used for months on two Macbook Pro 13" and a dual-boot Dell Linux/Windows 7 system
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this drive on three different laptops; two MacBook Pro 13" (both are 2012 editions), and a Dell 14z running Linux & windows 7 (dual boot). All of these drives have improved the speed of use on my family's macs, the Linux system. The Linux/Windows dual boot system boots far more rapidly. I'd estimate just over 25 seconds or so for either OS. The two MacBook Pro systems boot a little faster, but not as fast as the Linux or Windows systems. Overall I am very happy I've been using these drives for many months. I have various backup drives just in case, but have had zero issues with these drives, just solid reliability.
customer_reviews.author: John Carter

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced my laptop drive with this. I used clonezilla on a USB thumb drive (which I highly recommend - so easy) since cloning software was not included. I had a laugh when I removed my original hard drive - it looked exactly like this one only without the XT (Seagate Momentus 750GB). However, it's a totally different drive - with just the first boot I shaved 40 seconds off the previous boot time of 75 seconds. I expect that to improve over time as more and more files are loaded to the SSD. Chrome and Thunderbird start faster and faster with each load. I'm looking forward to faster boots and faster application loads.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Makes an old Macbook feel new!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 2010 Macbook Pro, and since it was running a bit slow and low on storage, I decided to opt for a hybrid rather than an HDD, and since I was low in money, I couldn't quite afford an SSD, so this was a good alternative. It's like having the best of both worlds. The speed of SSD by having essential programs stored on there, and the cheap hard drive space of a conventional hard drive. It booted up a lot quicker and opened programs much faster than stock. I love it! Plus I have tons of storage now on my laptop to store more big files like my movies, Premiere, After Effects, and Photoshop files.
customer_reviews.author: S. Misa

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over stock hard drive.
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded my 2008 Macbook Pro's hard drive. The original hard drive 250GB was filled almost to capacity with photos and home movies of the kids. So when looking into upgrading I came across this drive. And now the price has come down I've given it a try and the difference is amazing. Boot time went from over 2 minutes to under 30 seconds. All the application I use snap open within 2-3 seconds(iphoto, itunes, chrome. I am very happy. another 500GB of free space and a much faster user experience will probably give me another two years before an upgrade is necessary. Hopefully by then I'll be able to buy a Quantum computer ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to upgrade an old laptop
customer_reviews.text: I got this hard drive to upgrade an old MacBook. It is easy to install and it is able to have the balance of a SSD and large storage HD for a single 2.5" space. I have noticed the speed enhancement slightly. I would highly recommend this for owners who do not want to buy a new laptop but want the speed and storage enhancement. Apple is calling it their fusion drive but you can use the same thing with this Seagate model. I just wish they had a lager storage for my pro MacBook, as I need the spacc for all my photos and videos. But overall this is a must for users with a slightly outdate laptop.
customer_reviews.author: John PavlishTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It's DEAD!
customer_reviews.text: It was fine...before it died. Was using my laptop before work, closed the lid and came home and turned it on then "Missing operating system". No warning, no nothing. I checked to see if there was a valid warranty on this but through the seagate website it says there is NOT. My whole life was on this drive and being that it was a laptop I didn't have a way to have scheduled backups made. I would not recommend that anyone buy this drive. As of now I am going to continue trying to at least recover some of my data off of it on my own and future purchases will be with Western Digital, Crucial or Sandisk,
customer_reviews.author: Heavenly Skies

customer_reviews.title: Much better than older 500GB drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive for my new 15" MacBook Pro, replacing the original 750GB 5,200 RPM drive. Performance improved markedly over the original drive or the 500GB hybrid. The RPM boost improves performance even of data not cached in the SSD. The drive has far less vibration than the older 500GB hybrid, and a larger SSD cache -- in the 500GB drive my working set of files was bigger than the cache so I wasn't getting the performance improvement I expected. Not so here. As an added benefit, this drive uses 3/4 the power of the drive that came in my MacBook Pro. This will translate into greater battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Almy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use Right Away
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive to add to a new Asus laptop. I wanted to re-install the OS to remove all the bloatware that comes with any new laptop, and decided to replace the 750 GB drive with this one and make the old drive a second "D" drive. Installation was easy and the drive was recognized without issue. The machine appeared to boot faster after a few reboots, which was necessary to install OS patches and additional software. I continue to be very happy with the performance that I'm experiencing and would recommend this drive to anyone interested in getting better performance without buying a significantly more expensive SSD drive.
customer_reviews.author: Royce Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Incredible speed increase from 7200rpm WD Scorpio Black!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted better hard drive performance but didn't want to sacrifice storage space or spend a fortune on a huge SSD, so this product seemed ideal. I have an Alienware M15x (ver 2) Win 7 x64, Core i5 processor, 6GB ram. With the WD Scorpio Black it was booting from off to login in about 30 seconds, maybe 40. Now, it's 10-15 seconds. Photoshop launches in 5 seconds or less, Chrome comes up almost instantly. Whatever algorithm Seagate uses to 'decide' what to put on the 8GB of SSD at any given time in this thing works really well. Highly recommend this product!! Works great, quiet, and fast. No cons so far!
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: made a huge improvement in my macbook pro 13"
customer_reviews.text: I was a little pessimistic about how much difference I'd actually see if any upon installing this hard drive. But was out space so bought this Momentus XT 750gb for my 13" Macbook Pro (2011 version). I have to say I was very pleased with how much of a difference it made! Everything boots faster, photoshop and lightroom run smoother, and just doesn't get bogged down nearly as often. I'm also running it with 8gb ram, just fyi. Highly recommend it for those that just don't have the budget for the pure ssd--i'm very happy with the value and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dave'nJanna

customer_reviews.title: 2 times faster than my original 5400rpm HD...Super happy !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a way to increase the boot time and also the time it took my music editing programs to load. I don't know how to work on computers, but I decided to do it myself anyway. I went on youtube and saw a tutorial by this one guy and he made it simple...long story short, it took me less than 2 hours to get everything transferred, and working... I CANT BELIEVE HOW BETTER THIS NEW HYBRID DRIVE IS!!!! I had never opened up a computer before, but Amazon suggested purchasing the case for the external drive, which was essential. I saved myself 200.00 that my computer repair company was going to charge me.
customer_reviews.author: fponce

customer_reviews.title: Drive will not stop spinning
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if I got a faulty drive but after installing the Momentus XT 750gb into my Macbook Pro 2011, although I noticed a significan't increase in boot time and application opening, I couldn't help but notice the drives spinning issue. My battery time has gone from 5hours to barely 2 hours from a full charge and the disk in constantly spinning unless I shut the computer down or put the computer to sleep. This is my reason for giving the HD 3 stars. I think I am going to go back to a 500gb 5400rpm harddrive as the battery loss and noise of this drive is overwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Great performance matched with high capacity
customer_reviews.text: I was debating how to increase both storage space and performance in my 2010 MacBook Pro. I contemplated replacing the optical drive with a hard drive tray, providing space for an SSD and large HD in combination. Then I read up on the Momentus XT. Without needing to hack the laptop, I am able to get much better performance than a standard HD, combined with much more space for my files. No, it's not as high-speed as a dedicated SSD, but the overall improvement is clearly noticeable. Hopefully, the reliability will continue to impress me as much as the ease and performance.
customer_reviews.author: B. Sandman

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I must say, this hard drive is outstading. I installed into my Dell XPS16 1645 entertainment laptop that I paid alsmost $1,800.00! (blue ray pl, I7 processor, 8 GB ram, and the best grafics card available when building at the dell website). The original hard drive was an Hitachi 500GB (7200rpm) hard drive and it was pretty noisy and slow at start up. This Seagate hybrid works amazingly, and it is quiter than my OE hard drive and has cut my operational boot up time more than half and my internet pages and applications load much faster as well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: STILL running flawlessly after several years
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a 750 GB hybrid unit for one computer and a 500 GB hybrid unit for another, shortly after they became available. Both made two older computers nearly as fast as many new ones are. Both run 12+ hours per day and have been trouble-free. These were the best upgrades for the money, that we made on either computer. Edited 11/26/19: UPDATE - Both continue to perform great, to this day! No discount or other compensation of any kind were received for this review.
customer_reviews.author: InLionSk8r

customer_reviews.title: Good but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this internal hard disk for my MAC Workbook Pro laptop. i liked the idea of 32 mb of solid state circuitry to hold programs for booting up and starting frequently used programs. The laptop does boot up faster than ever. Programs do start faster. There was a problem in some of the solid state circuitry chips, which caused boot up failures. I had to trade for a new one, which solved the boot up problem. The product is good, but Seagate has recently changed to a new strategy and stopped making this one. It's still a good cholice.
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop Drive
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Dell XPS factory installed Samsung drive after it started to fail after a year old with this Seagate Hybrid 750 gigabyte hard drive. My laptop boots up in 30 seconds now compared to close to two minutes with the old hard drive. It is very quiet and very fast. I just wish it came in a 1 TB size. Well, no it's not a full SSD drive, but for this price and it's speed, quietness, and size it is a great replacement laptop hard drive. This is the best bang for your buck. Although SSD drives are somewhat faster their size and price can't make up for speed difference they provide.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Operates everyday with consistant results
customer_reviews.text: I use this drive as my main system program storage. I have a separate Seagate Momentus 500gb drive for my data files. The drive runs day in and day out and is sometimes on for as long as a week if a big project is underway. It handles all my programs running on Windows 7 Professional 64 bit with the Virtual XP mode for older programs that won't run on the 64 bit platform. The unit has been powered on for nearly 2900 hours total and has currently today been running for 8 hours and it now at a temperature of 42°C, well within the drive capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: William W. Gorman Jr.

customer_reviews.title: My Laptop is running like new now
customer_reviews.text: My Toshiba Qosmio drive was running tight on space and I knew I wanted to make it last at least another year before upgrading laptops. I used the data-transfer kit by Apricorn (also bought on Amazon) to move my data to the new harddrive. Comes with the data-transfer software and USB-to-SATA cable. I'm pretty sure it's the cheapest solution you can find to do so. Upgraded my 500GB 7200RPM drive (with only 9GB available) to this Seagate Momentus XT 750Gb Hybrid Solid-State. Very glad I did! Immediately my laptop was performing better with the faster drive and available space.
customer_reviews.author: Charleston Agent

customer_reviews.title: So much faster!
customer_reviews.text: My friend's hard drive was slowly failing and her computer was becoming increasingly unusable. Her computer is nearly 4 years old and so it didn't make sense spending a couple hundred dollars on a SSD. For less than $100 I was able to triple her storage capacity and reduce computing time (startup time went down to 23 seconds!). We'll see how durable it is, but Seagate makes good drives, so I have faith. Already bought another for a friend with another old computer. Best way to breathe life back into an aging system!
customer_reviews.author: A. Galdi

customer_reviews.title: a real let down
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for a while now and have not seen a positive difference. Spec wise this should be amazing but its just loud, hot, and slower then my stock 5400prm 750gb HHD. I wiped comp and reloaded Win 7Pro for a fresh beginning and gave it time to "learn" my comp but even after a month it just doesn't seem to be running any faster on a real performance bases and nothing has improved in Win performance test. My experience with WD Black HHD has been much better as well with Crucial SSD. If this were $50 it would hold you over until you could get WD or Crucial.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value. Reliable and very, very fast.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best upgrades you can purchase. Ton of storage is offered and the hybrid set up delivers fantastic performance for the money. This HD works perfectly in the mid-2010 13" MacBook Pro. If you need a new drive definitely get this one. Worth every penny. UPDATE: The drive continues to perform extremely well. Random reads and writes (using Blackmagic Disc Speed Test) are consistently 160MB/s and 140MB/s respectively. Start up improved by about 30-40% over the standard 5400 RPM drive. I'm very happy with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The best performance value in computing
customer_reviews.text: Everyone who buys a computer should do two things if they are interested in performance. Go to Crucial.com and max out your RAM memory, and get a hybrid drive. The 750 GB version is faster than the 1 TB version, as the larger drive spins at 5400 RPM. I used the Apricorn SATA Wire Notebook Hard Drive Upgrade Kit with USB 2.0 and you can read my review of it. Love the drive, things keep getting faster. I don't have time to give you lots, of stats, you can read Geek reviews for that. Just do the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: jkk5us

customer_reviews.title: Boosted Performance
customer_reviews.text: I replaced drives in our two 13" MacBook Pro systems. One is a mid-2012 model and the other is a 2010 or older model. I noticed immediate improvements in overall performance. I have my MacBook Pro set to actually hibernate (not just sleep) and it wakes and gets to the point of login much faster (perhaps about 5 seconds instead of the 30 seconds to a minute that it used to require). It's been a long time since I noticed an overall boost of performance after upgrading a hard drive. I'm very pleased with these hybrid drives.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly slow
customer_reviews.text: I ran benchmarks against my 64GB Crucial SSD and an older 10K WD Raptor platter drive, and was surprised that the 10K RPM hard drive outperformed this in most tests. I expected to see some benefit from this "hybrid drive", but as far as I can tell, it may as well just be a 7200RPM hard drive. I'm not really sure what benefits I'm getting from it, but it does still work fine as a hard drive -- I may have just had false expectations as to what I should expect from it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Who cares how fast it boots if it won't run?
customer_reviews.text: I run a 2.4 ghz late 2011 macbook pro. Amazon shows that I bought this drive in November of 12. I'm writing this in Jan 15. I began to get "drive integrity" warnings about 6 months ago. I ran all my drive repair programs but nothing would stop the warnings that the integrity of my drive was failing. It finally failed altogether about 2 weeks ago and will not boot. Should I buy another Seagate hybrid drive? Not without the $10 2-year backup protection.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Coward

customer_reviews.title: First drive did not work
customer_reviews.text: I have installed memory and hard drives before, although in desktops, and this was my first update to a laptop. However, I think I did my homework, and I installed the hard drive only to have it throw status 0xc00000e, that the computer could not communicate with the hard drive. I double-checked, and the connection seems rock solid. I took it out and put the old drive back in; no problem. I am returning it and hope the 2nd one is more cooperative.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: screams
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, I am amazed. The first startup I was concerned because there was a lot of "writing" noise, but I think that was because it was writing the OS and my most common apps to the SSD memory. Now, however, it is as silent as my previous drive, only the startup speed is way faster, and real turkeys (like Word) start up in a reasonable amount of time, while fast starting apps like Safari just pop up. I can't speak for durability, but hopefully that won't be an issue. So far, it's like having a new computer, especially that outside of the HDD, my computer was fast to begin with (2011 PowerBook Thunderbolt).
customer_reviews.author: wdc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hybrid Drive
customer_reviews.text: This drive would be the second hybrid that I have purchased. I bought my first as a HDD for my desktop last summer and it is still going strong. My second was for my playstation 3 which has seen improved loading times and seemingly more fluid performance. I bought this over the 3rd gen hybrid because of the 8gb SLC SSD vs 8gb MLC in the gen 3. The benchmarks for gen 2 vs gen 3 paint the two as having their own boosts in speed in different areas. Since I don't plan on ever upgrading the HD in my playstation again I wanted the endurance of SLC over MLC ssd.
customer_reviews.author: GZ

customer_reviews.title: Great blend of power and capacity.
customer_reviews.text: This HDD has been quite a wonderfully fast and efficient drive. It's definitely no where near the speeds of SSD, but the maximum efficiency from combining the size of HDD with the SSD for start up power and launching apps is a great blend of power and size of HD. I've owned it for over a year now and it hums right along. It installed easily in my 2011 15" MBP. It doesn't spin too loudly and is effectively a great addition to my computer, as I have TONS of usable space to work with. :)
customer_reviews.author: Sven Skarie

customer_reviews.title: Getting better!
customer_reviews.text: My third Seagate Momentus, and the best installation experience yet! Backup your files, definitely, but the installation went quite well. However, post installation, there was enough niggling minor problems, especially with indexing and search, that I went with a different search engine, then ultimately re-installed Windows 7. Once that occurred, it was flawless, super speedy, and much more enjoyable! It turned out to be even faster than the one on my ASUS ROG G75!
customer_reviews.author: H. Thomas H.

customer_reviews.title: Small speed increase for crazy price. Buy a 500GB SSD instead
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to do. But the touted speed increases are minimal. If you're going to spend this much on a hybrid drive, just get a 500GB SSD for the same price. The noise level with the 7200RPM gets frustrating over time. I've found that Seagate hard drives are noisier than other brands, even in the 5400RPM category. This product would have been a solid buy in 2010 but it's obsolete as of 2015.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Malin

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a WD 750 Scorpio on my MacBook Pro 17 (mid 2010). The first few hours it seemed like very little improvement. As I used my Mac more, after a day or so, I started to notice tremendous speed improvements in app launches, closing, etc. No more beach balls. After 3 days, I am blown away. Everything is very snappy. Highly recommend this hard drive. I think I'll hold off on that MacBook Pro retina display with SSD purchase for now! My mac is now buttery smooth - even with 20+ tabs open in Chrome.
customer_reviews.author: Bullminator

customer_reviews.title: Snappy access... most of the time. (manage your expectations)
customer_reviews.text: The cost increase for the performance increase is almost nothing. For a tiny additional cost, I get some nice snappy responses and then some usual HDD activity. This isn't a performance monster, but I think most users already sort of knew that. Its all the storage of a traditional spinning disk, with some nice caching performance. It isn't an SSD. Its a standard hard drive with some enhancements. I think if you keep that in mind, you'll find this a pleasant and cost effective upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Y. Le

customer_reviews.title: No performance increase, failed after six months.
customer_reviews.text: Can't realy recommend this drive at all. I was hoping for an increase in speed, but never saw one whit of performance increase. Might as well have bought a cheaper drive. And less than six months after installing it, my system started freezing, and investigation revealed the drive had started failing. I'm going to have to replace it. Given that I look for two things in a drive, speed and reliability, this one has failed on all counts.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Feinman

customer_reviews.title: Definite speed boost but runs HOT
customer_reviews.text: I didn't do any formal tests but I do notice a little boost in performance especially the time it takes to boot up my laptop. I replaced a conventional 750GB 7200rpm drive with this hybrid one. I've had it in my 2 year old Dell XPS laptop for 6 months now. I am running Windows 8. It runs HOT during basic usage. I like the speed boost so much that I am putting up with the heat but it has made me consider yanking the drive. The wrist pad over the drive is VERY warm. Other than the heat, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas ParkerTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my hard drive and installed it with a fresh copy of Windows 7 Home Premium (64 bit) on an HP Pavilion Dv4 with 4 GB of RAM. This computer is screamingly fast now! It may not be a solid state drive but I can definately tell the difference in speed over the original drive. I can reboot the computer in under a minute now. I would highly recommend. The only thing that might be an issue is reliability over time (since that is a major concern in other reviews). I guess time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Deverall

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Button to desktop in 9 seconds literally!
customer_reviews.text: Hard drive crashed and had to replace it with something. Was going to go with standard HDD but... Happened to see this at a BB store... well, checked it out and Amazon had it for $70 dollars less! Prime Shipping plus a couple dollars and I had it the next day! No brainer. Perfect fit to replace my 2.5", easy, silent, super fast. If you were debating on getting this drive I can't say enough good things about it. It is a true winner and awesome capacity to boot (pardon the pun) :)
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Solid R/W Speeds
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this in a mid-2010 MacPookPro with a SSD as the boot drive and this SSHD installed via the optical drive's SATA port. In tandem with the SSD, this drive is excellent. I am using it for data storage for which it works excellent. It has read/write speeds that are nearly as fast as my SSD. Overall solid drive, although I feel it works best when done in tandem with an SSD. It is ok on its own as a boot drive but closer to HDD speeds. The only thing I regret is not saving for the 1tb model.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell C

customer_reviews.title: Wow this hard drive is Freaking Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Fast, Fast, and did i mention Fast!!!! My laptop is like a whole different machine... I never really thought much about my boot time and how fast certain apps loaded slow like iTunes and Audials10. But no more!! This drive makes it move it move it! I don't understand the whole technology nor do I care too.. Just plain and simple it works!! 5/29/2013 - All I can say is that this drive is still amazing me at how much faster my laptop is... I really feel like it's new. Best investment I've made in upgrades in along time! Thank you Seagate for making and amazing drive..
customer_reviews.author: I'll try it

customer_reviews.title: SSD like feature is a stretch
customer_reviews.text: Good product but the claims are inflated, Unless you boot or in general load some files often from this the SSD part of this drive is useless as the Windows caching mechanism is doing a better job. If you are just storing data that is usually random accessed then save money and buy a regular 7200rpm HDD. I gave it 5 stars because it is useful if you use it as the disc where OS and program files are otherwise this is a waste of money. It runs quiet and cool.
customer_reviews.author: Doru Nica

customer_reviews.title: so far no firmware revision
customer_reviews.text: Im glad for the space but there wasnt a big speed difference in my opinion. I cant say for sure the harddrive is to blame but since Ive upgraded my battery drains much faster doing the same things I used to. I cant seem to find specification sheets to compare against my old hard drive. However this works well for my purposes and the additional space is welcome for archiving I have been checking the seagate website and so far there is no firmware revision to adjust power usage but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: An instant improvement at a very reasonable cost!
customer_reviews.text: I recently upgraded my my 2006 PC laptop and 2009 Macbook Pro with these hybrid drives, and has been very happy with this choice. The hybrid drives offers an instant improvement in start up speed, and most of commonly used apps (Word, Excel, Photoshop, DVD player etc.) come up much faster than with regular hard drives. Apparently, the limited solid-state storage in the hybrid drives means that it can only store the "most often used" information, so I am not expecting their overall performance to fully match the stand-alone solid state drives. Nevertheless, the hybrid drive is probably the best choice for squeezing some extra performance from relatively old PC or Macs.
customer_reviews.author: Customer from Champaign

customer_reviews.title: NEat!
customer_reviews.text: This beast is fast! I was Worried my HP Pavilion dv7 laptop did not support SATA III 6Gb/s, however an easy check is to use PC-Wizard! I wanted a SSD but the 120 GB I have was not able to hold my recovery disk data from HP which requires at least 500GB. This Disk managed no problem, I let Clonezilla copy the old 5400rpm disk to this one instead of a clean install since I was under a deadline and needed all the current data. I am please with my refurbished buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mr.LindenWillow

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my mid 2010 MacBook Pro 13 inch
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions on how to install this on YouTube. I used Carbon Copy Cloner (don't use Time Machine to clone your HD because it wont copy your Operating System) to copy my existing hard drive to my new Seagate Momentus hybrid HD. This took about 3 hours. Afterwards, I installed the Seagate into the MacBook. Works perfectly. I noticed a slight increase in boot up speed but I'm not sure if its due to the SSD of this disk or the fact that I went from 5200rpm to 7200rpm.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan K. Park

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this drive. I am a solutions engineer for a software company, and I do lots of demonstrations. We have a lot of content in large VMware images. I used this drive in a caddy that I put in to replace the disk drive. So now I have 2 hard drives. Running images off of my regular SATA drive (inside my laptop) was very slow and frustrating. By freeing up the space on that hard drive and storing/running my images off of this hybrid drive I am much happier. The performance is much better. Instead of taking 5 minutes to get my demo up and running it takes 1. Could not be happier with this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR SO GOOD...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. incredibly fast boot-up times, from minutes to seconds. I'm having some issues with the Windows up-dates which I can't seem to fix. I have a Sony VAIO and the hard drive ( A THOSHIBA HHD2H81) was malfunctioning. Upon replacing it with the with a Seagate Momentus XT 750 GB 7200RPM SATA 6Gb/s 32 MB Cache 2.5 Inch Solid State Hybrid Drive ST750LX003, all is well. Those clowns at Sony want me to buy a recovery disc for my Windows Home Premium system LOL! I won't be buying a Sony again.
customer_reviews.author: Steely

customer_reviews.title: It sure performs a little better than 500 version
customer_reviews.text: Last year I bought a Momentus XT 500 GB from first version of the XT family. I bought a second drive from 2nd family of XT drives expecting to have an enourmous increase in boot speed, and program load. I bought it for a Dell Latitude E6510 which I wasn't aware it only supports SATA II 3GB/s which was a huge turndown for me since I can't explote all the new drive's potential. However, It has some remarkable features: Lower heat production, Lower sound when doing something extremely hard. Performs mostly like old drive.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for a mid-2012 MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Added incredible amount of speed to my mid-2012 MacBook Pro. I am assuming that Apple installed 5400 rpm drives in their MacBook Pro line to help with battery life - I have experienced no change in battery performance with this new disk installed. Most importantly, it allows me to run Windows 7 in VMWare Fusion pretty fast. I used to dread firing up the Win7 VM for something work-related I can't do on the Mac, now it's like I have two computers in one.
customer_reviews.author: W. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Nice improvement
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 500GB 5400 RPM unit and got an immediate speed boost. No problems at all. Just plug it in load data and go. The only "downside" is you get used to the speedup and want more. It's not until you use someone elses PC with a conventional hard drive and see how slow things are that you realize how much better you have it. I can't wait until the price of fully solid state drives come down to where I can afford them. Until then, I am enjoying the best of both technologies.
customer_reviews.author: Boat Boy

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first to invest any money into a hybrid technology basing my "fears" on what's going on with hybrid cars. Purchased this drive for a work laptop and immediately saw my boot times drop about 40-50% on 64-bit Windows 7. The drive is speedy and totally worth the money you'll spend on it. I have an older laptop at home which is about 3 years old now. With everyone else's machines and cool gadgets flying at rocket speeds these days I am actually thinking of buying a second drive for my home Sony just to get another year or two from it. (It's a first gen i7).
customer_reviews.author: Nash

customer_reviews.title: Great HDD
customer_reviews.text: First one I bought crashed in 3 days. They sent me another one, which was a hassle, but this one has been working great. I put this HD in a white macbook 3, 1 running 10.7.5. It has definitely speed up this computer as programs like photoshop now open in about 5 seconds where as before it took about 25 seconds. Bootup time hasn't improved much, maybe 5 seconds but everything else runs faster. I was skeptical because this mac is pretty old but pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: I took a chance with this awesome 7200 rpm hybrid drive (7200 rpm was supposed to ...
customer_reviews.text: My ps3 was always choppy when streaming Netflix and i could not find a fix. I was told there was a chance it was my hard drive but no one thought this could really be the problem. I took a chance with this awesome 7200 rpm hybrid drive (7200 rpm was supposed to be too fast and would run hot) it fixed my choppiness 100% and my ps3 runs way better and doesn't overheat. It was the best 75.00 investment i've made in quite some time. Awesome Drive indeed
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Better than a standard HDD, not as good as an SSD.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a corrupted Apple factory hard drive in my early-2011 Macbook Pro 15". This installed flawlessly. It's faster than the 7200 that was in there, but no comparison to the speed of a true SSD drive. It also runs a little noisier when spinning. If you want to get more performance out of your hard drive, without sacrificing capacity or your wallet — I'd recommend this. Pleased with it's performance over the past 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Fast and cooler running
customer_reviews.text: It is much faster than the stock WD 250GB 7200 drive that came with my Dell n5010 laptop with i5 450m processor. But the best thing is, it runs cooler. My n5010 was shutting down frequently during processor/HD intensive sessions. Even hitting 220F (which seems to be the shut down temp as I watched it go down). After I installed this drive and ran the same program that caused the laptop to hit 220F the other day, it maxed out at 180F which, while hot, doesn't shut it down.
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works great, love it!
customer_reviews.text: The drive runs a little hotter than the standard drive in my MacBook Pro, but that is to be expected since it is a 7200RPM drive versus the 5400 that was in it. I haven't had any problems with it and the install went off without a hitch. So far most of my work has been on the web and some banking and I've noticed a slight increase in performance loading, but nothing great yet. Still, it's a 750GB drive for a great price. I may put one in my Mac mini later.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Put into my daily work stations
customer_reviews.text: Several observations: 1. it is durable, I have put this drive into my work laptop, I use it in a daily basis, so far, no problem at all. 2. It is quite and unobtrusive. 3. Speed wise, it is faster than the run of the mill 5400 or 7200 rpm drives, but once you get used to it, you will still want o have more speed. It is slower than the true solid state drive (I have two from ADATA, they both are faster).
customer_reviews.author: ACW1120

customer_reviews.title: YOU NEED ONE OF THESE !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Recently had this installed to replace my Western Digital that died. Have been told by many in the industry that solid state is the ONLY way to go if you don't want your hard drive to die like my WD did. Kim Commando recommends this type of hard drive as well. Saw this linked in [...] to Amazon and had to have it. So glad I did. Very reasonably priced. It's half the size of the WD and yet holds nearly twice as much data. Go get one NOW!!
customer_reviews.author: CardinalRool

customer_reviews.title: VERY Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This drive lasted 3 months before it just crashed. While it did work it was excellent, much faster than an HDD. All of a sudden my laptop became non responsive, as it does happen with any drive, I figured it would clear out within a few seconds but I had to restart the computer and that was the end of it. No operating system found and then I tried to use it as an external drive to see if it could read the files, but no, I/O error. The drive is now a brick.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: A nice drive, my first hybrid drive
customer_reviews.text: Wanted fast and big and this drive delivers. Wow does my old PC start up (and open files) quickly! And best of all, my Windows 7 performance rating jumped from 5.2 up to 5.9! Now if those darn sticks of RAM were a bit quicker! All kidding aside...buy this Seagate drive. NOTE: Seagate has free cloning software at their website for you to use but you do need to have a Seagate drive involved. I love my old gaming PC once again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Invest in this product, save your otherwise good machine!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome piece of hardware. I bought it for my teenage son who was rebuilding his ASUS laptop that was about $2000 when bought new, and I wasn't ready to allow him to trash that laptop, YET! Ironically, I followed his advice and invested in this product. I have seen it in action. The laptop boots up Windows7 like lightning. Makes my AMD QuadCore HP laptop look like a snail in comparison during bootup!
customer_reviews.author: TimeTravellerTop Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to SSD
customer_reviews.text: Fast, easy to install. What's not to like. Bought two for my older Mac Pro2.1. With an OWC sled adaptor I did a clean install of OS X 10.7 and migrated from my old drive. Once I had verified the new boot disk was AOK I switched it to my primary boot drive and repurposed the old slow drive to be a backup drive. Ready to upgrade my iMac with the other drive. Great price, exceptional performance boost for my older hardware.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Comish

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from a traditional 5,400RPM hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hard drive as a replacement for my 1TB 5,400 Hard Drive that came with my Dell XPS 15z. I considered purchasing a 128GM solid state drive, but needed more capacity and the 256Gb SSD was at least $175 so I decided to take the plunge. Overall, the drive is a nice compromise. Much quicker boot ups and shut downs. File searches aren't nearly as fast as they were with an SSD drive, but overall, nice value for the $$$.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic L

customer_reviews.title: New life in older Laptop, but...
customer_reviews.text: Really like the performance increase and elbow room on the hybrid drive. Unfortunately, it crashed hard after 4 months, without provocation (no drops or impacts on computer). The crunching sound was obvious. On the good side, excellent warranty service from Seagate to swap the replacement. I paid for the 2nd day delivery of new drive with re-use of box and prepaid return shipping. New drive working blazingly fast and flawlessly. I have not had any of the battery issues others have seen with problems of the drive not spinning down. I still recommend this for the MacBook crowd.
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: Wish boot time could be a little bit faster.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced this with my Corsair SSD 240GB since higher capacity SSD is still way to expensive. I wish boot time was a little bit faster. I'm running Mac OS X 10.8.4 with 2.4GHz Duo core and 8gb of ram. I timed it and it took about 1 min and 4 sec to get to the log on screen. Once I passed beyond log on screen, Apps seem to load faster including web pages when I surf. It's good for now untill larger capacity SSD become more affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: Works with my Early 2008 15" MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Used SuperDuper! to clone my OSX to this drive (connected via usb->sata connector). Then booted off the usb just to test...It worked! Boot time was unnoticeable especially since I was booting off the usb. After the real internal drive swap, this drive booted my system in ~10seconds! Awesome, love the increased space from 200GB to 700GB and speed. Feels snappier. The system does feel hotter temperature wise than what I remember though.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon_dude

customer_reviews.title: Great Apple Hard Drive Replacement
customer_reviews.text: It's fast, I can not hear it working and it's been going for six months now. The only catch is getting it set up working after removing my old drive. I needed help at the Genius bat at the Apple store getting it "journaled" where I was in a touch over my head but most people who would be comfortable buying and replacing a drive would be happy with this one. Oh, one more thing it runs cool, no burning lap with this drive.
customer_reviews.author: virginia P.

customer_reviews.title: Not that fast...Stop working after a year!
customer_reviews.text: Not fast, no real difference from any standard conventional hard disk. As others reviews stated, Seagate is manufacturing some pretty cheap bad made devices and this hard disk is one of those. Avoid purchasing any Seagate device, go for solid state or a conventional hard disk, this hybrid ones are good for charge you more and that's it. The hard disk stopped working after only one year and now I'm struggling to save my data. D O - N O T - B U Y!
customer_reviews.author: Josito

customer_reviews.title: Saved my Macbook Pro!
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive on my 15" Macbook Pro (late 2008 unibody) was shot. I needed a replacement to save my computer and this sure did the job. This hybrid drive reduces the boot up time greatly and speeds up every day tasks. My computer runs possibly even better than new now and saves me the cost of buying a new computer. It offer performance close to a solid state drive at a fraction of the cost. For those who want high performance on a budget, this is the best option out there.
customer_reviews.author: Liam W

customer_reviews.title: Great Price/Size/Performance
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace the 5400 RPM 750GB drive that came in my Late 2011 15" MacBook Pro. WOW! What a difference! OSX boots in half the time (less than 30 seconds) and applications launch very quickly. Even WinXP, running under VMWare Fusion, boots in about half the time it did with the stock drive. If you're looking for increased performance out of a hard drive upgrade, need the high capacity and can't afford an SSD, this is a great SSD/HDD hybrid.
customer_reviews.author: MacMan

customer_reviews.title: New drive but not OEM packaging. ??
customer_reviews.text: To be clear: The drive seems new as it is in sealed anti-static bag, but NOT in factory box and not with any factory documentation such as warranty registration card. Just wrapped in standard (not anti-static) bubble wrap and crammed into a box barely bigger than the drive itself. Maybe part of a bulk/enterprise shipment for PC builders? Just seemed odd.
customer_reviews.author: tlhIn`toq

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Quiet and works in my 2010 Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a stock 5200 RPM 250GB drive in my 2010 Macbook Pro 13.3". The old drive was pretty slow and started making a clicking noise, so it was time. The Seagate drive is a perfect fit for my macbook, and it's FAST!!!!!!!! It's also whisper quiet. My old drive would make a bit of noise, and so far this one is SILENT. The computer boots up faster too! I am very pleased with this drive, and hopefully it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: 2Lawyer

customer_reviews.title: Best $90 spent my whole life!!!!..thank you Seagate
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly as described. Awesome improvement in my laptop performance. my laptop was dead slow being a basic one and everything used to take ages to load. after installing this and cloning, everything is super fast and windows loads 3 times faster!!!..even the regular performance is huge difference...best $90 I have spent my whole life...perfect compromise for SSD like performance and price. This was what I was looking for exactly
customer_reviews.author: Gopala Dandu

customer_reviews.title: pretty damn fast
customer_reviews.text: as everyone has said, this hybrid drive is a good trade-off. the speed of ssd vs the storage capacity and price of hdd. My windows 7 laptop now boots up notably faster. File transfers are about the same, though, I think. I haven't done too much on that end of things yet. So far, seems reliable. No issues. If anything, I think this drive runs cooler than my old 350gb 5400rpm hdd. At least I don't feel a warm spot on that part of the laptop anymore. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hannahs

customer_reviews.title: GREAT UPGRADE
customer_reviews.text: I was due for an upgrade of the original 500gb hard drive on my "work horse" Toshiba lap top computer. I happened upon the "Seagate Momentus XT 750 GB" on sale here at "Amazon". The increase in drive/application load speed and the extra storage room of this combo "SSG/HDD" hard drive should have me not needing to upgrade my laptop for a least a few more years. Do yourself a huge favor and include the "Apricorn SATA Wire Notebook Hard Drive Upgrade Kit ASW-USB-25 (White)" with your purchase. It will make the drive change over partially painless/effortless.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert L. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Superb Performance!!
customer_reviews.text: Seagate has really done an incredible job with this drive. My Windows 7 64-bit Home Premium is booting up in under 15 seconds which is a great improvement over the standard SATA hard drive (boot up time in minutes). Also its really cost effective since you 750 GB for $117 (now the price has further come down) which is currently not possible with SSD drives. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Doomsday

customer_reviews.title: The best HDD I have had
customer_reviews.text: The best HDD I have had. Period. I replaced the one that came on my 2012 Macbook Pro and it was a huge difference. Booting tame changed from 1:20 minutes to around 20 seconds. And the overall usage of the computer speed up a 200%. I bought this one when SSDs when for the same price of this drive you could only afford a 128 SSD. Now you can afford a 256 SSD. Still if you are looking for 3 times the space of an SSD without sacrificing much performance, go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: The performance of an SSD with the storage of a conventional drive
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drive running a macbook pro for a couple of years and it's fantastic. It's a 7200rpm drive that gives you the perforamnce of an SSD for your most frequently used applications (photoshop and lightroom in my case). Until large capacity SSDs are reasonably priced, this is the way to go for inexpensive, fast, large capacity drives.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: This worked very well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hard drive because I was afraid that the hard drive in my laptop was beginning to fail. It worked very well and now my laptop seems to run much faster. Caution: It is necessary to use a third party tool, like Acronis, to backup the data and OS from the original hard drive and then to restore the data and OS on the new drive. Everything went very smoothly and I had no problem booting the laptop from the new hard drive after the data and OS had been restored.
customer_reviews.author: Mark MacNab

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this drive to replace the stock HDD that came with my HP G6 2210us. At first I was shopping around for a 7200RPM drive but I saw this and decided to give it a gamble. Seagate products have personally never failed on me but of course, YMMV. The performance is great and it's definitely an upgrade. 7200RPM AND SSD for caching? super fast compared to my old drive. My windows 8 gives it a 5.9 rating which is above average. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Ily_goblin

customer_reviews.title: Surprised @ the packaging; equally Surprised @ performance
customer_reviews.text: Just a heads up on the packaged. This comes shipped without the packaging or box from Seagate. While it's not a deal breaker since I was able to get this at a value of 13 cents per GB, the package will be shipped with Seagate packaging. That said the unit is super fast! I had a computer repair person install it and it even blew him away. The computer loads up lickety-split!
customer_reviews.author: Houdini_Unchained

customer_reviews.title: Great hard drive for MBP
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded a 2010 13 inch MBP to this drive and upgraded to 8gb of RAM and boot time went from 45 seconds to 15 seconds. Most of the speed showed up after installing the hard drive. The drive did take a couple boots to cache information to the SSD and then that's when the speeds started to improve drastically. Upon initial installation the boot times were 1:30. But then they eventually dropped down to 15 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert L

customer_reviews.title: Best Value Laptop Drive On The Market
customer_reviews.text: There's no doubt that we would all like to have Solid State Drives in our computers, but the price (while a much better value lately) is still rather substantial when compared to traditional platter hard drives. This Hybrid drive offers the best of both worlds at a reasonable cost. I highly recommend this drive. I've installed two of them in my 18 inch laptop and can truly say these drives deliver a hefty increase in performance.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: 750GB
customer_reviews.text: I installed this drive in a mid-2012 2.6GHZ i7 MacBook Pro replacing the stock 5400RPM drive. I have to say I am amazed by the difference in speed. Boot up time from power on to the log in screen went from over a minute all the way down to 17 seconds (!!!!!). Programs now launch almost instantly whereas I used to wait from 10-15 seconds for some programs to load. I've only had it installed for a day so I have not had any issues so far. I'm honestly speechless and I cannot believe Apple sell's their computers with such slow stock hard drives. I wish I would have upgraded sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Fast Drive For Linux
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive to set up a dual boot Windows/Ubuntu system. I use Ubuntu almost exclusively now. The boot time on the system is very fast, typically from 0 to login in about 20 secs. The drive performs well. Some others have reported that these drives either work great or are DOA. This is true, the first drive I received didn't work at all. Seagate has a good performer here, but they need to work on their quality control.
customer_reviews.author: AquaTom

customer_reviews.title: Blazing speed + tons of space = WIN
customer_reviews.text: I love this drive so much. I wanted an SSD, but I need more than 256GB of space, and the 512GB + size SSDs are still a little too expensive for me. If you're in a similar boat, this is the drive for you. The 8GB of built-in flash memory helps the drive "learn" which programs you access most often, and helps open them with SSD speed. Same for booting. I can open Photoshop in 2 seconds. My boot time has dropped to 14 seconds cold, and I didn't have to give up space for the speed. This drive also comes with a beefy 5-year warranty. I dropped it in my MacBook Pro, and it's noticeably faster. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Simone

customer_reviews.title: Can you trust Seagate?
customer_reviews.text: Two if these failed in one year in a macbook that only sets on my desk and get occasional use. Getting warranty replacements from Seagate was do difficult I gave up. Every time I called the Seagate support system had technical problems and the agent could not process the return. Makes me wonder if that might be intentional to prevent returns.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Rocket Hybrid Drive
customer_reviews.text: This drive is an amazing boost in speed with the capacity of a large laptop drive. I mostly run Fedora Linux, which boots from cold, dead off to login screen in 14 seconds. Yeah, a little rocket. Data transfers are incredibly fast. I also run Win 7 on a small partition and yes Windoze is noticeably faster as well, but I don't spend a lot of time in that environment. I would recommend this drive to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Wow! What an improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of great reviews here with tests and stats. They were very helpful in making my decision. Just first impressions here. I'm amazed at the speed increase. I replaced a 5400 500GB Hitachi drive that came in my Sony laptop. The laptop is just over a year and a half old, has 4GB of RAM and a Core 2 Duo processor. Everything is noticeably faster. Where it had been sluggish it's much more snappy. Wish I had done this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Drive Okay Until Crash / Horrible Company to Buy From
customer_reviews.text: I have had the drive since June (about 7 months) and it is now giving me all sorts of errors. I tried calling OnSale, and they hung up on me three times. I was polite and just asked the procedure for return. The first one didn't answer and the phone went dead. The second one was asking me to look up the serial number and the phone went dead. The third time I called, the person said hello, and the phone went dead. I am hoping to get a replacement directly from Seagate, but I would never buy another thing from OnSale.
customer_reviews.author: Renee M. Ramig

customer_reviews.title: Best hybrid on the market
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I just bought this to replace the old 500gb 5400rpm stock HDD in my Toshiba Qosmio X770. The new drive is not only much much faster, but is extremely quite. I use my laptop to play video games, which during cinematics and other fast passed actions had a "Stutter" which is a lag in the game with no FPS drop. This new drive fixed the problem right up. The boot time is also much quicker. The "Flag" screen that appears when windows is loading is almost entirely skipped. The only bad thing I have to say about this drive is that there is a noticeable difference in temperature when the drive is under load.
customer_reviews.author: Saint Crazy

product_meta.title: Seagate Momentus XT 750 GB 7200RPM SATA 6Gb/s 32 MB Cache 2.5 Inch Solid State Hybrid Drive ST750LX003
feature_bullets: Solid state hybrid drive delivers SSD-like performance with hard drive capacity options
Adaptive Memory technology customizes performance by aligning to user needs for overall improved system response
80 percent faster performance than traditional 7200-RPM drives in PCMark Vantage benchmark scores
